item.title: Very responsive support team...
item.dc:creator: Victor Goff
item.content:encoded:
Syntax Highlighting

We'll also handle syntax highlighting with CodeRay for code blocks that are preceded by two tabs. You can specify what type of syntax want us to highlight by using the #! operator followed by the name of the language.

Note: Markdown specifies that for a syntax highlighted code block to be identified, you must be sure to indent all lines of desired syntax highlighted code with at least 4 spaces or 2 tabs.
via posterous.com

Markdown - Posterous Help is where you will find this bit of information... my suggestion was the Note: ".." as I had to experiment with it to find out how to get it to work correctly (in a web based mail client).

Wow, posterous.com support is very responsive. I suggested the change in their help file, and it was in place within 24 hours. (I now wish I would have been keeping track of the time and the resolution!)

Based on another question they have answered, I wouldn't be surprised if it was in fact done within a couple of hours.
Is this the norm?
